TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit OleDbParameterCollection extends System.Data.Common.DbParameterCollection

Attribute.AttributeName: System.ComponentModel.Editor("Microsoft.VSDesigner.Data.Design.DBParametersEditor, Microsoft.VSDesigner, Version=10.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a", "System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor, System.Drawing, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a")

Docs.summary: Represents a collection of parameters relevant to an <see cref="T:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbCommand"> as well as their respective mappings to columns in a <xref:System.Data.DataSet>.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The number of parameters in the collection must equal the number of parameter placeholders within the command text, otherwise the .NET Framework Data Provider for OLE DB might raise an error.
## Examples The following example creates multiple instances of <xref:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbParameter> through the OleDbParameterCollection collection within the <xref:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbDataAdapter>. These parameters are used to select data within the data source and place the data in the <xref:System.Data.DataSet>. This example assumes that a <xref:System.Data.DataSet> and an <xref:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbDataAdapter> have already been created with the appropriate schema, commands, and connection.
[!CODE [Classic WebData OleDbParameter Example#1](../CodeSnippet/VS_Snippets_ADO.NET/Classic WebData OleDbParameter Example#1)]

Docs.returns: The index of the new <see cref="T:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbParameter"> object.

Docs.param: The <xref:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbParameter.Value%2A> of the <xref:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbParameter> to add to the collection.
Docs.summary: Adds an <see cref="T:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbParameter"> to the <xref:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbParameterCollection> given the parameter name and value.
Docs.returns: The index of the new <see cref="T:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbParameter"> object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use caution when using this overload of the <xref:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbParameterCollection.Add%2A> method to specify integer parameter values. Because this overload takes a of type <xref:System.Object>, you must convert the value to an <xref:System.Object> type when the value is zero, as the following C# example demonstrates.
``` parameters.Add("@pname", Convert.ToInt32(0)); ```
If you do not perform this conversion, the compiler will assume you are attempting to call the <xref:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbParameterCollection.Add%2A> overload.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example creates an <xref:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbParameterCollection>, adds instances of <xref:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbParameter> to the collection, displays the names of its <xref:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbParameter> objects, and then clears the collection.
[!CODE [Classic WebData OleDbParameterCollection.Count Example#1](../CodeSnippet/VS_Snippets_ADO.NET/Classic WebData OleDbParameterCollection.Count Example#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Data.OleDb.OleDbParameter this[string parameterName] { get; set; }
.property instance class System.Data.OleDb.OleDbParameter Item(string)

Docs.param: The name of the parameter to retrieve.
Docs.summary: Gets or sets the <see cref="T:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbParameter"> with the specified name.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example searches for an <xref:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbParameter> with a given <xref:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbParameter.ParameterName%2A> within an <xref:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbParameterCollection>. If the parameter exists, the example displays the name and index of the parameter. If the parameter does not exist, the example displays an error. This example assumes that an <xref:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbParameterCollection> has already been created.
[!CODE [Classic WebData OleDbParameterCollection.this1 Example#1](../CodeSnippet/VS_Snippets_ADO.NET/Classic WebData OleDbParameterCollection.this1 Example#1)]
